description:
The BaseShield App Store is a distribution platform for Windows software. Users can download and install applications with one click, and each application runs in its own secure virtual space.

It is an open platform where third party developers can publish their applications. Developers who deploy their apps this way can rely on the built-in installer, update function, security and eventually payment processing.
generated_description:
Ninite is a startup founded as part of Y Combinator's Winter 2008 batch, located in San Francisco. At its core, Ninite simplifies the tedious process of patching and deploying third-party applications on Windows systems. With a small team of just two, it has built a reputation as a trusted solution for users looking to install and update applications seamlessly.

Initially launched as The BaseShield App Store, Ninite's platform allows users to download and install multiple software applications with a single click. The applications operate in a secure, virtualized environment, and the web interface is clean—no toolbars or extra clicks required. Users simply select the apps they want from a curated list, and Ninite handles the rest.

This efficiency has its roots in automation; Ninite's bots continually check for updates, ensuring that users' software remains up-to-date without the hassle of manual oversight. Each day, the service powers the installation and updates of about a million apps for both home users and Ninite Pro subscribers, underscoring its widespread adoption.

On the developer side, Ninite serves as an open platform allowing third-party developers to publish their applications. This includes leveraging Ninite's built-in installation procedures, update functions, and security measures, making it an attractive option for those looking to reach a wider audience without grappling with the complexities of software distribution.

For organizations with multiple machines to manage, Ninite Pro offers additional features for managing software deployment from a centralized web interface. Thousands of organizations use Ninite Pro to maintain and secure their software efficiently, reinforcing its value as more than just a utility for individual users.

In sum, Ninite captures a simple yet powerful idea: a streamlined experience for software installation and maintenance that saves users time and effort. If you're running Windows and frequently find yourself installing software, Ninite is a tool worth checking out. Their website is [ninite.com](http://ninite.com), where everything operates ad-free and with minimal fuss.
headline: Simple third-party app patching and deployment for Windows.
name: Ninite

description:
RescueTime helps you set boundaries, protect focused work time, and achieve work/life balance by shedding light on how you spend your time, improving your focus, and helping you find more time for the things that matter most.

We are a distributed company with members spread throughout the United States.
founders: [{'name': 'Brian Fioca, Founder', 'description': "I've been a product engineer for over 20 years, working across all platforms: web, mobile, and desktop; and across many languages, including: Java, PHP, Ruby, C++, Swift, Javascript, and more. \n\nI've worked with more than 10 startups and founded 5, including RescueTime, which went through Y Combinator in 2008. I also helped start Madrona Venture Labs, the incubation arm of investment firm Madrona Venture Group.", 'linkedin': 'https://www.linkedin.com/in/brianfioca/'}]
generated_description:
**RescueTime: A Simple Guide to Reclaiming Your Time**

Founded in 2007 and part of Y Combinator's W08 batch, RescueTime has had a solid 17-year run helping people take control of their time. Based in Seattle, WA, the company operates with a team of 15 dedicated employees, all spread out across the U.S., building a remote-first culture focused on enhancing productivity.

### Mission and Vision

RescueTime’s mission is straightforward: *Take Back Control of Your Time*. The tool is all about understanding how you spend your time, so you can create clearer boundaries, boost your focus, and, ultimately, achieve a healthier work/life balance. By providing insightful analytics on your daily habits, RescueTime helps you prioritize the things that truly matter.

### What They Offer

The platform offers a suite of features geared towards both individuals and teams:

- **Automatic Time Tracking**: It tracks how you spend your time without needing manual inputs, making data collection effortless.
  
- **Focus Sessions**: You can block distracting websites and apps to enhance your concentration.
  
- **Goal Setting and Tracking**: Set personalized productivity goals and monitor your progress with reports and insights.
  
- **Automated Timesheets & Project Tracking**: Say goodbye to manual logging. RescueTime automatically tracks projects for you, simplifying timesheet generation.
  
- **Privacy Focused**: Unlike traditional employee monitoring tools, RescueTime enables a respectful environment by granting autonomy to users while still offering the necessary data for accountability and productivity improvement.

### Pricing

RescueTime offers flexible pricing plans to cater to individual users as well as teams. For individuals, the annual subscription is $78 USD (about $6.50/month), and for teams, it’s $72 per member annually ($6/month, with a minimum of two seats). If you're curious, you can try it for free for 14 days before committing.

### Why Choose RescueTime?

With over 2 million users and 3 billion hours logged, RescueTime has established itself as a trusted resource for productivity enhancement. Notably recognized by PC Mag as a five-star product, it has garnered endorsements from founders like Alexis Ohanian of Reddit and Neil Patel of KISSmetrics, attesting to its impact on efficiency and focus.

### Final Thoughts

If you find yourself struggling to manage your time effectively, RescueTime could be the tool you need. By shedding light on how you allocate your hours, it not only promotes productivity but also ensures that you’re making time for the things that truly matter in life and work. So why not take a leap and reclaim your time? 

For more information, check out their website at [RescueTime.com](http://rescuetime.com).
headline: Take Back Control of your Time
name: RescueTime
